alert.note: Alert for Bighorn Mountains Southeast; Northeast Johnson County; Southeast Johnson County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 2:01PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Johnson County through 230 PM MDT... At 200 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 13 miles east of Powder River Pass, or 15 miles south of Buffalo, moving very slowly to the southeast. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, half inch hail, and heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of central Johnson County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Bighorn Mountains Southeast; Northeast Johnson County; Southeast Johnson County
